text: Oskar Fischer (19 March 1923 - 2 April 2020) was an East German politician. He was Minister of Foreign Affairs of the German Democratic Republic from 1975 to 1990. Fischer was the first member of the East German cabinet to visit Pope John Paul II at the Vatican in 1978. He was born in Aš, Czechoslovakia. Fischer died on 2 April 2020 in Berlin, aged 97.Langjähriger DDR-Außenminister Oskar Fischer gestorben ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1923 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Czechoslovak people Category:Ambassadors of Germany Category:Government ministers of East Germany Category:Members of the Volkskammer Category:Politicians of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany Category:Foreign ministers of Germany
title: Oskar Fischer
